sect1.title: About PMB
sect1.para: "PMB is a completely free ILS (Integrated Library management System) . The library software domain is almost exclusively occupied by proprietary products. We are some librarians, users and developers who disapprove of this fact.
PMB is based on web technology. This is what is sometimes called a `web-app`. It requires an HTTP server (such as Apache although this is not obligatory), the MySQL database and the PHP language.
The principle functions of PMB are :

listitem.para: A simplified OPAC integrating a library navigation framework
A module for the management of BDP (French regional lending libraries) documents appropriate to the smallest establishments
A simplified administration process usable by library personnel...

sect1.para: Supplementary information can be found at www.sigb.net
Also at this site are an online demonstration version, the PMB users website, the latest versions of the Installation Guide, the User Guide and the PMB Administrator Guide.

Via the mailing lists for translators, developers, for unicode support (non European alphabets). For more information on these lists, go to www.sigb.net

sect1.title: CVS
sect1.para: CVS stands for Concurrent Version System. It acts as a system for the management of source code updates for programmers.
PMB uses a CVS. The CVS is accessible for developers. Do not hesitate to contact us if you wish to help with the development of PMB or to participate in the drafting of documentation.
For more information, look for CVS at www.sigb.net
